Introduction to Testing

This is a test page for the Notion to Slides extension.

It contains multiple slides separated by H1 headings.

Key Features

Parsing

The extension parses Notion DOM using ARIA roles and CSS selectors.

  • Heading detection (H1-H6)
  • Paragraph extraction
  • List parsing (bullet and numbered)
  • Image and code block support

Navigation Controls

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • → or ↓: Next slide
  • ← or ↑: Previous slide
  • Home: First slide
  • End: Last slide
  • Esc: Close presentation

Text Formatting

The extension preserves various text formatting options:

Bold text for emphasis

Italic text for style

Inline code for technical terms

Code Example

Here's a simple TypeScript example:

interface Slide {
  id: string;
  title: string;
  blocks: NotionBlock[];
}

Testing Strategy

Unit Tests

Test individual components in isolation

Integration Tests

Test the full parsing to slide generation flow

E2E Tests

Test the extension in a real browser environment with Playwright

Conclusion

This test page demonstrates all the key features of the Notion to Slides extension.

Thank you for testing!
